qas.question: How did Foucault describe the social duty of police?
Which economic theory did Foucault say supported the police?
Why did the functions of police grow beyond law enforcement to urban planning?

answers.text: because of the miasma theory of disease; thus, cemeteries were moved out of town, etc.

qas.question: How did Foucault describe the social duty of army?
Which economic theory did Foucault say rejected the police?
Which biology theory did Foucault say supported the police?

plausible_answers.text: because of the miasma theory of disease; thus, cemeteries were moved out of town, etc.

qas.question: Why didn't the functions of police grow beyond law enforcement to urban planning?

context: As conceptualized by the Polizeiwissenschaft,according to <a0_0><b4_0>Foucault<b4_0/><a0_0/> the police had an administrative,economic and social duty ("<a1_0><b5_0>procuring abundance<b5_0/><a1_0/>"). It was in charge of demographic concerns and needed to be incorporated within the western political philosophy system of raison d'état and therefore giving the superficial appearance of empowering the population (and unwittingly supervising the population), which, according to <a2_0><b6_0><b7_0>mercantilist theory<b7_0/><b6_0/><a2_0/>, was to be the main strength of the state. Thus, its functions largely overreached simple law enforcement activities and included public health concerns, urban planning (which was important <a3_0><b8_0>because of the miasma theory of disease; thus, cemeteries were moved out of town, etc.<b8_0/><a3_0/>), and surveillance of prices.
